Node.definition: = action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
literally: to replace (one's) strength; hence: = action by which humans receive new strength
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which someone causes someone else's inactivity to end so that he comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: to meet; hence: = process by which a certain event starts affecting someone
literally: foot; hence: = action by which humans put one foot before the other ► in order to move forward

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: to tread underfoot; hence: = causative action by which humans or, by extension, deities use force to bring (other) humans and areas under their authority and control|see ריד (ריד)
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned
= process by which the wind causes objects to be moved from one place to the other
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= relatively narrow road (דֶּרֶךְ) that connects two locations and facilitates travelling
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

Node.gloss: a man ... his brother > one ... each other
Node.definition: = expression denoting a situation in which two people or objects that are regarded as masculine are involved in a reciprocal event

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be strong (mentally)|to be courageous|to stand firm|to be resolute
Node.definition: = state in which humans are mentally strong and able to deal with issues relating to good leadership, morals and ethics, war, and the supernatural world
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to be mentally strong and able to deal with issues relating their daily work, good leadership, and war
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= someone whose profession it is to work with precious metals, such as gold and silver
= to cause an object to have a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations

= instrument of about 30 centimeters long, consisting of a handle, usually made of wood, to which was attached a stone, wooden, or (less frequently) metal head; ► used for many purposes, including the breaking or dressing of building stones, pounding nails or pegs into wood, or pounding pegs into the ground; also used by blacksmiths to shape hot metal

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a hammer (הַלְמוּת) or with their feet
literally: foot; hence: = a heavy piece of metal that served as a base for hammering and shaping other pieces of metal

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= area where two objects have been joined together permanently
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans ensure that an object cannot be moved from its place
= thin piece of metal (usually iron) sharpened on one end; ► used for attaching pieces of wood to each other or to the floor
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities take or maintain firm control of (other) humans or objects

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= remote part of a location
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame
= process by which humans or deities experience extreme displeasure, ◄ described as an internal fire
= state in which an object is non existent, implying that it has been destroyed, or that it exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= violent struggle possibly involving physical force
= state in which an object is non existent, implying that it has been destroyed, or that it exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
= state of being non existent, implying that an existing object has been destroyed, or that an object exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
literally: a person of battle; hence: = a person that is of age and physically able to bear arms
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= a general term for worms of all kinds; ≈ associated with uncleanness, decay, and insignificance

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= human beings, regardless of sex and age

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= wooden board with sharp stones or pieces of iron tightly wedged into small holes; ► dragged over harvested grain with the help of a draft animal to separate grain from straw or husk; ≈ symbol of power and aggression
= state in which objects have been provided with a thin cutting edge
= state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced
= inanimate object, with focus on some of its features
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= causative action by which humans or deities reduce an object to fine particles; ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the destruction of a kingdom
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= causative action by which humans throw grain into the air so that the wind will remove the chaff

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= flowing body of water
= a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream
= an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= small body of stagnant water, usually in swampy area; ≈ seen as a blessing when contrasted with the desert, but as a curse when contrasted with a developed area

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
literally: the going out of water; hence: = water which flows out from an underground source
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

= evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

= a desert tree, reaching a height of 3 5 m, with a wide crown; it has sharp spines, finely divided leaves, and tiny pale yellow flowers arranged in drooping bunches; it produces a bean pod that is twisted and looped when dry; ◄ a member of the Mimosa family, Acacia tortilis or Acacia raddiana; ► its wood is used for construction

= an evergreen tree or bush, up to 1.5 m. high; dark glossy leaves are dense on the branches, and the flowers are white or pink; the whole plant gives off an agreeable odor; ► used by the Jews in the Feast of Tabernacles; regarded as a desirable tree, as opposed to thorns and thistles

= an evergreen conifer that grows to a height of 20 meters and can live as long as 150 years; ◄ Pinus halepensis; Aleppo pine; ► the wood is suitable for carpentry work, and the leaves for building booths. Or alternatively, olive tree (oil tree)
literally: oil tree; hence: = wild olive tree; ◄ Olea europaea oleaster

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon

= sturdy evergreen shrub that reaches 3.5 m in height, with dark green, shiny leaves, white flowers, and poisonous purple berries; ◄ Viburnum tinus; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon

exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
= state in which multiple events are connected
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
literally: to bring near; hence: = causative action by which humans make a certain matter publicly known

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to bring near; = causative action by which humans cause an event to happen to other humans
= pertaining to what is in support of one's position or point of view

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward|to bring close|to bring near|to present|to offer
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference|= causative action by which humans cause (other) humans, animals and objects to move to a location closer to a point of reference

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
literally: to come; hence: = process by which things happen to someone ◄ as if it were a person coming to visit
= referent to a time that is yet to come
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is morally and/or ethically right

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear|read ירא (ירא)
= state in which multiple events are connected
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state in which an object is non existent, implying that it has been destroyed, or that it exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
= object of small or no value
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= causative action by which someone causes someone else's inactivity to end so that he comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective
literally: the rising of the sun: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun
literally: to call on (someone's) name; hence: = action by which humans acknowledge a deity and are willing to live in accordance with some of the requirements of that deity
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= a person of authority

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= a person who makes pottery out of fired clay

= wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority

Node.gloss: to respond|to bring back word|to report
Node.definition: literally: to bring back word; hence: = action by which humans respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
= state of being non existent, implying that an existing object has been destroyed, or that an object exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
= state of being non existent, implying that an existing object has been destroyed, or that an object exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= something that has no value and hence does not profit anyone
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold; ► functions as an object of non sanctioned worship
